name: Lavender Face Cream
description:
Does your face have dry or damaged skin? Would you like a face cream that not only moisturizes but is also filled with anti-oxidants, vitamins and beneficial oils? Does the smell of Lavender leave you relaxed and ready to take on the day? Dragonfly Dew’s Lavender Intense Face Cream gives you the moisture that you need and the pampering your face deserves. Just a small amount of this penetrating face cream will soothe and protect your face while smelling fantastic at the same time. 

Best for dry skin types, everyone who uses it notices how effective it is at restoring moisture and balance to their skin. Try it yourself, your skin will thank you!

Ingredients: Shea Butter, Apricot Kernel Oil, Almond Oil, Cocoa Butter, Tapioca Starch, Vitamin E, Lavender Essential Oil.

To use: Massage a small amount onto face and neck, working upwards and outwards. Let your skin absorb the cream for approximately 5 minutes before applying makeup. For External Use Only, contains nut oils.

1 fl oz \ 30 ml jar.

name: Rose Hip Face Serum
description:
Rose Hip Serum from Dragonfly Dew contains organic, moisturizing plant oils from Rose Hips and Tamanu (Calophyllum), wildcrafted Roman Chamomile Essential Oil, along with Apricot and Macadamia Nut Oils. This very rich face serum is golden in color with a wonderful scent. Just a few drops a day massaged into your face will leave it moisturized and glowing.

Rose Hip Oil has long been known as one of the best oils for mature and damaged skin, is very high in essential fatty acids and is full of Vitamins A and E. Tamanu (also known as Calophyllyum) Oil has been extensively studied throughout the world for it’s antibacterial, anti-microbial, anti-inflammatory and anti-fungal properties. Apricot Oil moisturizes while it softens with high amounts of anti-oxidants, vitamin E and oleic acid. Macadamia Nut Oil is moisturizing without being greasy, softens skin and is thought to be anti-microbial. Essential Oils of Roman Chamomile and Rose Geranium are added for their calming and balancing properties.

Rose Hip Face Serum is best used on any skin type other than oily or acne-prone skin.

To Use:  Each morning or evening, put 3 or 4 drops onto fingers. Gently massage into face, avoiding eye area due to essential oils. If using during the day, it’s best to wait 5 minutes or so for the Rose Hip Face Serum to sink in prior to applying your makeup.

Ingredients: Apricot Kernel Oil, Organic Rose Hip Oil, Organic Tamanu Oil, Macadamia Nut Oil, Wildcrafted Roman Chamomile Essential Oil, Rose Geranium Essential Oil.

15 ml / .5 fluid ounce bottle, packaged in an amber glass bottle with tamper evident cap and orifice reducer dropper. Comes in a non-bleached muslin bag.

name: Jojoba Eye Serum
description:
Jojoba Eye Serum from Dragonfly Dew is made purely with moisturizing plant oils each picked for their helpful properties that work wonderfully on your skin. Jojoba Oil is one of the oils (really a wax ester) that acts most like our skin’s own sebum. It’s non-greasy yet moisturizing and works well with all skin types. My favorite “oil” for my eyes, I use it every day! Apricot Oil moisturizes while it softens with high amounts of anti-oxidants, vitamin E and oleic acid. Macadamia Nut Oil is moisturizing without being greasy, softens skin and is thought to be anti-microbial. I love it for it’s smooth, silky feel in creams and lotions. And finally Rice Bran Oil is rich in both vitamins and anti-oxidants, great for your face or anywhere else.

Exquisite Oils for your beautiful eyes. Each golden, moisturizing drop sinks quickly into your skin.

To Use:  Each morning or evening, put 1 or 2 drops onto finger. Working from the lower inner eye outward, gently spread the oil along clean lower eye and brow area, avoiding eyelashes.  Repeat on other eye.  If using during the day, it’s best to wait 5 minutes or so for the Eye Serum to sink in prior to applying your makeup.

Ingredients: Jojoba Seed Oil, Macadamia Nut Oil, Apricot Kernel Oil, Rice Bran Oil, Vanilla Bean Oil.

15 ml / .5 fluid ounce bottle, packaged in an amber glass bottle with tamper evident cap and orifice reducer dropper. Comes in a non-bleached muslin bag.

name: Moisturizing Lip Balm
description:
My all natural Lip Balms by Dragonfly Dew contain moisturizing Cocoa and Shea Butters, nourishing Apricot Kernel Oil, and Beeswax from Colorado to help keep all that moisture on your lips instead of vanishing into thin air. Add in natural Vitamin E, infused herbal oils and pure essential oils, and your lips get a perfect combination of ingredients that you won't want to be without! 

Not too soft, not too firm, just that perfect consistently you love in a lip balm. No Artificial Flavors, Colors or Fragrances, just great protection and creamy goodness for your lips! 

Each Lip Balm is packaged in a .15 oz tube, shrink-wrapped for extra freshness.

Flavors:

name: Whipped Shea Body Butter
description:
This light, fluffy, extremely moisturizing body butter is pure bliss for your skin. Made with only Shea Butter, Virgin Coconut Oil, Vitamin E and Essential Oils, our Whipped Shea Body Butter is "purely good for your skin". Whipped until it feels like the yummiest whip cream, it immediately sinks into your skin with it's nourishing oils.

To Use:  Apply a small amount to anywhere on your body that needs moisture!  Especially good for hands, feet, elbows and knees.  A little goes a long way!

Each 4 oz. jar is packed by volume, not by weight and is shrink-wrapped for freshness.

Ingredients: Shea Butter, Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, Organic Natural Vitamin E, and Essential Oil. 

Note: This Whipped Shea Body Butter will melt at high temperatures. Please keep in a cool place. 

Choose between the following scents:

Vanilla Coconut - Smells like being on a tropical island, drinking coconut drinks.
Lavender - Pure Lavender Bliss.
Juicy Orange - Bright, vibrant, juicy Orange.
Pink Grapefruit - uplifting, cheery, a burst of freshly squeezed juice.
Peppermint - Super Minty, a Peppermint lover's dream.
